page.title: 05Landscape near Oldmeldrum
page.content: The Locheter burn (stream) forms the boundary between the parishes of Meldrum and Bourtie. Oldmeldum is the market town for Meldum parish and Bourtie is centred at kirkton of Bourtie, traditionally part of the Barra estate. Today the Bara estate encompasses all of the Iron Age hillfort on the Hill of Barrra, used to graze sheep and cattle, two conifer plantations at airyhillock and Fordalehouse (pron. fordale/ess), about \ sq mile, and about 150 acres of open farmland dotted with deciduous trees, mainly beech, which are rented to five farmers for crops including winter barley, spring barley, winter wheat, grass for silage and grazing for cattle. Other small holdings raise sheep, pigs, barley-fed cattle on speciality farms. Pheasant and French Partridge are also reared in the area.
